hedline.hl1: Top Effie Award Goes to Apple

abstract.p: Apple Computer and agency TBWA/Chiat/Day win top prize at New York chapter of American Marketing Association's 32nd annual Effie Awards presentation for effectiveness in advertising (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Apple Computer and its agency, TBWA/Chiat/Day in Playa del Rey, Calif., part of the TBWA Worldwide unit of the Omnicom Group, won the top prize last night when the New York chapter of the American Marketing Association presented its 32nd annual Effie Awards, which recognize effectiveness in advertising.

Apple and TBWA/Chiat/Day were awarded the Grand Effie for the ''Think different'' campaign, which also won a Gold Effie in the computer category. For the agency, it was the second consecutive year of winning the top prize, after being honored for work for the Taco Bell unit of Tricon Global Restaurants .

Apple Computer and its agency, TBWA/Chiat/Day in Playa del Rey, Calif., part of the TBWA Worldwide unit of the Omnicom Group, won the top prize last night when the New York chapter of the American Marketing Association presented its 32nd annual Effie Awards, which recognize effectiveness in advertising.

Apple and TBWA/Chiat/Day were awarded the Grand Effie for the ''Think different'' campaign, which also won a Gold Effie in the computer category. For the agency, it was the second consecutive year of winning the top prize, after being honored for work for the Taco Bell unit of Tricon Global Restaurants .

Three agencies tied for winning the most Effies, with eight apiece: FCB Worldwide, part of True North Communications; McCann-Erickson Worldwide Advertising, part of the McCann-Erickson World Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies; and Young & Rubicam Advertising.
Two companies were inducted into the Marketing Hall of Fame: Volkswagen, for long-established brands, and America Online, for newer brands.
